causality.effect: Device ends Conversion and enters Acquisition/Data Readback phase
causality.condition: The high pulse on CNV has lasted for at least tCONV

causality.effect: SDO is enabled and outputs the MSB of the conversion result after a delay of tEN
causality.condition: Start of the Data Readback phase

causality.trigger: Each subsequent falling edge of SCK
causality.effect: SDO output is updated with the next bit from the internal shift register after a propagation delay of tDSDO

causality.trigger: After 16*N SCK cycles, where N is the device's position in the chain
causality.effect: The device begins outputting the data shifted in from its SDI pin

constraints.tCONV: Conversion time, the minimum required duration for the CNV high pulse.
constraints.tACQ: Acquisition time, the minimum time required between the end of a conversion and the start of the next.
constraints.tSSCKCNV: Setup time requirement for SCK to be stable (low) before the rising edge of CNV.
constraints.tHSCKCNV: Hold time requirement for SCK to remain low after the rising edge of CNV.
constraints.tEN: SDO enable time, the maximum delay from the falling edge of CNV until SDO is driven with the MSB.
constraints.tHSDO: SDO hold time, the minimum time the previous data bit is held valid on SDO after the SCK falling edge.
constraints.tDSDO: SDO propagation delay, the maximum time it takes for the new data bit to be valid on SDO after the SCK falling edge.
constraints.tSSDISCK: SDI setup time, the minimum time SDI data must be stable before the falling edge of SCK.
constraints.tHSDISC: SDI hold time, the minimum time SDI data must remain stable after the falling edge of SCK.

states.description: CNV is low. The device is in a low-power state, acquiring the analog signal. The text specifies that when both CNV and SDI are low, SDO is driven low.
CNV is high. The device is actively performing the analog-to-digital conversion. This phase must last for the duration of tCONV.
After CNV goes low, the conversion result is ready. The SCK clock is used to shift the 16-bit result out via the SDO pin, MSB first. This state overlaps with the next Acquisition phase.
